document.heading: Prevention of the Spread of the Human Immunodeficiency Virus and Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome Amendment Act of 1994

history.narrative: Law 11-3, the “Prevention of the Spread of the Human Immunodeficiency Virus and Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome Amendment Act of 1994,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 11-38, which was retained by council. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on January 17, 1995, and February 7, 1995, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on February 17, 1995, it was assigned Act No. 11-10 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 11-3 became effective on April 7, 1995.
